intro: Cochlidiosperma sibthorpioides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which contributes to its common name. Cochlidiosperma sibthorpioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
